result.execSummary:
The defendant Deautris Q Mattison was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Costs to be paid $25.00 each month commencing 12/02/2022 and each month thereafter on the 1st of each month or penalty of civil judgment for non-payment.
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

records.addlTxt: signed by the defendant and defense counsel on August 8, 2022

11:48 AM Defendant Deautris Q Mattison in court with attorney Justin G Griffis.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Victim rights have been complied with by the Waukesha County District Attorneys Office.
Court conducts a plea colloquy with defendant. 
Defendant enters a plea of guilty to Count 1. 
Court finds the defendant guilty to Count 1. 
Court dismisses and reads in Count 2. 

Court orders the following:
2 DAYS Waukesha County Jail 
2 DAYS credit
 TIME SERVED

Costs:  $243.00
DNA Sample and Surcharge:  $250.00
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
To be paid at the rate of $25.00   per month, starting  12/2/22     and the 1st of every month until paid in full.
Alternate:  entry of civil judgment
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.
Plea/sentencing hearing on August 8, 2022 at 11:00 am.

Atty Griffis requests a plea and sentencing date.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 8, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Defendant appeared late. Court completed for the morning. Judge Bugenhagen ordered the case to be scheduled back on the calendar and warrant discarded.

Body only. 
Bail Jumping case - Milwaukee County 20CF4167. 
EXT = 1.

10:20 AM Attorney Justin G Griffis in court.   Defendant Deautris Q Mattison did not appear.   Kevin Michael Osborne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State motions the Court to issue a warrant for the defendant and to revoke and forfeit any bail. Defense requests the court stay a warrant. Court forfeits and revokes bail and will issue a warrant.
Defendant waives his right to a Preliminary Hearing.

10:18 AM Defendant Deautris Q Mattison in court with attorney Justin G Griffis.  Chelsea Thompson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The Court finds that the Defendant's waiver to a preliminary hearing is knowing and voluntary.  Waive reading of Information.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Hearing scheduled for May 20, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Defendant is not to operate a motor vehicle unless properly licensed.  Comply with all licensing restrictions.

02:43 PM Defendant Deautris Q Mattison in court, in custody, with attorney Justin G Griffis.   Christian Farina appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is eligible for State Public Defender representation.  An attorney will be appointed.  Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  Preliminary Hearing requested.  Preliminary time limits waived.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 18, 2022 at 10:15 am.
